constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 70 (Thursday, April 28, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. THOMPSON of Pennsylvania:
H.R. 7614.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
The ability to regulate interstate commerce and with
foreign Nations pursuant to Article 1, Sectin 8, Clause 3
including the power to regulate digital commodity exchange
markets.
[Page H4609]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commodity Exchanges, Energy, and Credit.

title: Digital Commodity Exchange Act of 2022
